channel.title: R on Oscar's Datascience Blog
channel.description: Recent content in R on Oscar's Datascience Blog

item.title: Principle Component Analysis (PCA) with R
item.description: Abstract PCA is a statistical technique used in many different settings. Often it is used in data analytics to reduce the dimensions of a variable set. This is done through the linear combination of the raw variables to produce a set of components the aim of which to capture the maximum amount of variance with the minimum number of components. \[PC_{1} = w_{1}x_{1} + w_{2}x_{2} + ... + w_{n}x_{n}\] \[PC_{2} = w_{n + 1}x_{n + 1} + w_{n + 2}x_{n + 2} + .

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
